snippet: President Obama will seek to address the disappointing housing sector Thursday, lowering insurance rates on federally issued mortgages to first-time home buyers, minorities and struggling Americans.
abstract: Pres Obama will try to rectify slow housing sector by dropping insurance rates on federally issued mortgages to first-time home buyers, minorities and low-income Americans; modest move would give savings of $900 annually per home buyer.

byline.contributor: Michael D. Shear contributed reporting from Phoenix.

lead_paragraph: President Obama will seek to address the disappointing housing sector Thursday, lowering insurance rates on federally issued mortgages to first-time home buyers, minorities and struggling Americans.

headline.main: Obama to Outline Proposals to Bolster a Lagging Housing Sector
headline.print_headline: Obama to Outline Proposals to Bolster a Lagging Housing Sector
